Name: Kitty Monroe
Description:
Kitty died after attacked by a couple and then run over by at least three vehicles - one of them belonging to her attackers.

> The first trans person killed in 2024 is Kitty Monroe, 43. Equally important, she lived in Phoenix, Arizona. Also, Kitty was a Latina trans woman.
> 
> Witnesses who came forward have said she was attacked about 2 a.m. Jan. 1 by a man and woman in the parking lot of Casa de Licores, a liquor drive-thru on Broadway Road near Ninth Street, the family said. 
> 
> Phoenix police spokesman Sgt. Philip Krynsky told The Republic the initial investigation indicated the case was being handled as a fatal hit-and-run. Krynsky said he could not share some details of the case out of concern it could hinder the department’s investigation.
> 
> The family said a witness told her a man and woman were chasing [Kitty], with the man slugging her in the back with a gun. Collapsed on the ground, Monnroe was then run over by the man’s black two-door truck, which was described as making a loud noise as if it had no exhaust. The family was told another driver then accidentally hit Munnroe.
> 
> There is no other information on the identities of the people who chased and assaulted Kitty or the two drivers who apparently ran over her body after she collapsed.

The other victim was Luís Zito Mendes Delfino, 45.

The Military Police are actively involved in search operations for the suspects, whose identity remains unknown. The motivation behind this violent act has not yet been clarified by authorities.

Investigations are ongoing, and police forces remain dedicated to clarifying the details of this regrettable episode and bringing those responsible to justice.

Name: Giovana Souza
Description:
Giovana was stabbed in the street by her boyfriend. He fled but was arrested shortly after.

> A 28-year-old transgender woman, identified as Giovana Souza, was stabbed to death last Wednesday (10), in the Eldorado neighborhood, in the northern region of São José do Rio Preto, in the interior of São Paulo.
> 
> According to information in the police report, Giovana was found lying on the street, with intense bleeding in the chest area. She was conscious when she was approached by people passing through the neighborhood and told that she had been attacked by her boyfriend. An ambulance from the Mobile Assistance Service (SAMU) was called and rescued the victim, but she did not survive. The death was confirmed by the doctor on duty at the scene.
> 
> The Military Police carried out a patrol in search of the suspect, also 28 years old, who had fled and was found in a prostitution area. See below, security circuit images that show the suspect fleeing shortly after stabbing the victim. He appears running, wearing a purple t-shirt and white shorts: 
>

>

> 
> The femicide occurred on January 12 at a home in the Rincón de Los Reyes neighborhood in the municipality of La Paz, where the victim and an eyewitness were attacked by Jovani "N" and another subject, after the victim's sexual identity was revealed.
> 
> According to the investigation, Jovanni N., the accused, allegedly complained to the victim for not mentioning [that she was trans]. He hit her in the head and stomach until she was unconscious ; the teenager died in a hospital due to the injuries she suffered.
> 
> On August 9, the Attorney General's Office of the State of Mexico arrested Jovani N. in the Doctores neighborhood of the Cuauhtémoc municipality in Mexico City, where he was hiding.

Name: Bunitinha
Description:
Bunitinha was killed by her partner. He was arrested.

> A 33-year-old man has been arrested in Ribeirão Preto, in the interior of São Paulo, on suspicion of killing his partner, a 57-year-old trans woman. The crime took place on the afternoon of Saturday, 13th, in Jardim Piratininga.
> 
> The crimes of domestic violence and feminicide due to futile appeal were recorded in the police report. Military police officers were called by the Mobile Emergency Care Service (Samu) team at around 5:20 pm after the coroner confirmed the victim's death, according to the Civil Police.
> 
> The woman was killed in the house where she and the suspect lived, and her body was found in the bathroom. With several injuries and a broken arm, the victim had signs of suffocation in his neck.
> 
> The suspect told police that he was sleeping and, when he woke up, saw the woman's body on the floor. The man was arrested in the act and had his prison converted to preventive custody at the weekend.
> 
> According to police suspicions, the couple had argued before the crime. The furniture in the house was overturned and some objects were broken.
> 
> In testimony, the suspect said he went out to collect recyclable material and then drank, on Friday, the 12th. When he arrived home drunk on the morning of Saturday, the 13th, he noticed that the victim's body was injured and the furniture was outside the room. place, but did not ask what had happened. According to the report, the man claims that the couple had sex and then he fell asleep. When he woke up, the suspect claims he found the body on the floor and went to a neighbor so she could call EMS.
> 
> The team found that the victim was dead and, given the evidence, the suspicion was domestic violence - thus calling the PM. The case is under investigation.

Name: Cristina Ramires ("María bonita")
Description:
Cristina was murdered in her home by armed assailants. She was intersex, and worked in the production and sale of indigenous fabrics. 

> Tonight we received the painful and regrettable news that Cristina Ramírez, an intersex woman in her late 40s, was murdered in the municipality of Montelíbano, located south of Córdoba. According to preliminary information from witnesses, the woman was violently approached in her home, where armed subjects shot her four times, causing her death. At the time this statement was published, people close to the victim assure that there were no known threats against her. Cristina, who was also popularly known as 'María bonita', was dedicated to the production and sale of indigenous fabrics, for which she was known and appreciated in the municipality. 
> 
> This heartbreaking event has increased the perception of insecurity among LGBTIQ+ citizens in the municipality, as it occurs in the context of other acts of violence that have occurred against people with diverse sexual orientations, identities and/or gender expressions in Montelíbano during the last months of 2023 and the beginning of this year. This also refers to the violent death of Daniel Preciado, a 24-year-old gay man from the municipality, which occurred on December 29. His body was found in front of the Montelíbano Ecological Park. 
> 
> This situation has motivated LGBTIQ+ people and the Montelibanese community to urgently call for the installation of a security council to prevent and investigate the different types of violence that are occurring in the municipality and that, consequently, are differentially affecting LGBTIQ+ people, as they are a historically excluded and vulnerable group in that subregion and in the rest of the country.

Name: Dr Samantha Carolina Gomes Fonseca
Description:
Samantha was shot by a hitman while riding in a taxi. She was the second trans politician to be murdered in Mexico in a week, following [Miriam Nohemí Ríos Ríos](https://tdor.translivesmatter.info/reports/2024/01/11/miriam-nohemi-rios-rios_zamora-michoacan-mexico_c0eb43d6).

Samantha was a Movimiento Regeneración Nacional (Morena) party candidate for the Mexican Senate who had been awarded the Medal of Merit for her work as a Human Rights Defender in 2022.

> A trans activist is killed aboard a taxi by application in Xochimilco; They shot her 14 times
>
> The first investigations indicate that the crime occurred after Samanta Fonseca left the Reclusorio Sur, where she held a meeting. For those in charge of the investigations, the murderers were already waiting for Samanta to kill her.
> 
> The first police reports indicate that the crime occurred this Sunday afternoon minutes after 6:00 pm in the surroundings of the Parish of Santiago Apóstol Tepalcatlalpan, on the corner of calle Del Trabajo with Cuauhtémoc in the Xochimilco Mayor's Office.
> 
> An ambulance assigned to the emergency arrived at the point to provide pre-hospital services but after a quick check they could only confirm that she no longer had vital signs.
> 
> Relatives of the deceased arrived at the cordoned-off site, screaming and crying inconsolably over the death of their loved one.
> 
> During initial police investigations the victim was identified as Samanta Fonseca, a trans woman and candidate for the Senate of the Republic for the National Regeneration Movement Party (Morena).
> 
> “In a cowardly way, the life was taken from our colleague and friend, Dr. Samantha Fonseca, a brilliant woman with an extensive career in the defense of human rights and against discrimination, who was awarded the Medal of Merit for the and Human Rights Defenders 2022".
> 
> “Samantha dedicated her life to different causes focused on the political participation of LGBTIQ+ people and the defense of the rights of people deprived of their liberty,” the legislator wrote.
> 
> According to preliminary information, the Senate candidate had planned to attend a demonstration this Monday in front of the Senate of the Republic to the mobilization for the dignity of trans women that is scheduled for 2:30 pm Samantha Gomes aspired to be a senator for Morena because she signed up for the party's internal selection process.

Name: Blaire Crits-Christoph
Description:
Blaire died by suicide. She was a software developer and musician who loved acting.

> Blaire ([deadname redaacted]) Crits-Christoph, of Dallas, TX, passed away on January 15, 2024. Blaire was a triplet, born second along with her older brother and younger sister in Sacramento, CA.
> 
> Blaire grew up in West Chester, PA, first attending Westminster Presbyterian Church preschool, then kindergarten through 5th grade at Collegium Charter School. She then attended Fugett Middle School and subsequently West Chester East High School. Since purchasing a house on the bay in 1999, Blaire and the family spent every summer since age 6 in Brigantine, NJ. In addition to enjoying the beach, boat rides, and friends in Brigantine, she was active in theater camp every year, often in the lead role in musical theater productions. She also was passionate about playing the piano.  She became accomplished and was asked to accompany choral groups in middle school and jazz band in high school.
> 
> Blaire was also active in theater at West Chester East High School, where she graduated in 2012, and at the University of Pennsylvania, where she graduated with a degree in music in 2016. She loved her fellow Underground Shakespeare Company friends at Penn and also performed in the chamber music group accompanying other musicians.  While Blaire loved acting and the movies, music was her greatest love and she hoped to continue to be involved it throughout her life. In her last Facebook post she listed her 30 most beloved “works of art,” which were all musical albums and groups.  In 2019, Blaire initiated her gender transition.
> 
> After college during COVID, Blaire received training to be a software developer and was employed at Infosys until October 2023 focusing on programming apps for Apple devices. She moved to Dallas for her work in 2022. This past summer she connected with the LGBTQ community attending Gender Brave groups and activities sponsored by My Resource Center in Dallas.
> 
> Blaire is survived by her parents and brother and her sister. She was close to aunts and uncles and cousins, all of whom will miss her dearly.   
> 
> Relative and friends are invited to attend the funeral service on Saturday, January 27, 2024, at 11 am. A viewing from 9:30 am to 11 am will be held at the Brigantine Community Presbyterian Church, 1501 W. Brigantine Ave, Brigantine. Interment will follow at Laurel Memorial Park, Pomona.

Name: Mayla Rafaela Martins
Description:
Mayla's body was found wrapped in a plastic tarp and dumped in a farm area alongside the MT-485 highway between the municipalities of Lucas do Rio Verde and Sorriso.

Jorlan Cristiano Ferreira, 44, was convicted of murdering her, with a judge described him as cold, calculating and extremely violent. On the day of her murder, Mayla had shared a photo of the licence plate of his car with people close to her, and this helped the police to locate her killer.

> [Name redacted], a friend of trans woman Mayla Rafaela Martins, 22, who was stabbed to death on Tuesday (16), in Lucas do Rio Verde (333 km from Cuiabá), has stated that businessman Jorlan Cristiano Ferreira, 44, was obsessed with the young woman and chased her. 
>  
> Mayla's body was found wrapped in a swimming pool tarp on the banks of the MT-485, on the Morocó road, between Sorriso and Lucas do Rio Verde, by workers. Upon being detained, Jorlan informally claimed to the police that he was robbed by the woman when he opened his establishment in the city. 
>  
> During Mayla's wake, this Thursday morning (18), in Várzea Grande, the young trans girl's friends gathered to say goodbye, demanding justice. [Name redacted], who had known the woman for eight years, said that Jorlan premeditated the crime, as he kept threatening her. 
>  
> "This man, in addition to committing this barbarity with my friend, he premeditated, he murdered her, hid her corpse and disappeared with her cell phone. He had been having romantic encounters with her since the beginning of December. Since his wife traveled, he took her home, they had weekly meetings. There are messages, prints of her saying all this", he declared in an interview with journalists. 
>  
> "We want justice. Even after she's dead, he's framing my friend as a thief and saying she extorted him. Mayla didn't do that, she didn't carry a knife. She worked and took the money home," he added.
>  
> The friend also revealed that Mayla was afraid that something could happen because of the businessman's current behavior. In exchanges of messages with Rebeca, the victim, who worked as a sex worker, said that she had bought a ticket to return to Cuiabá, in order to escape the criminal's persecution, but was murdered first. 
>  
> "He chased her. He went to where she worked, he already told her not to stay on the street anymore, he was too jealous of her, he was obsessive. She bought a ticket to leave [to Cuiabá], but she didn't come.
>
>  She knew that one day this was going to happen, due to his threats. He had threatened her, because he didn't want her to leave. He was obsessed with her", he said. 
>  
> Mayla was buried this Thursday (18), in Várzea Grande. The young woman's sister used social media to fundraise in order to transfer the body. 

Mayla had moved to Lucas do Rio Verde for work in December of the previous year. Her objective was to save money to travel to Europe.

Name: Giselle Stone
Description:
Giselle died by suicide. She was a Jewish trans woman studying fashion and design.

> It is with great sorrow that our family shares the passing of Giselle ([deadname]) Stone, age 20. Although known for many years as [deadname], she made it clear that her final wishes were to be known and remembered as Giselle.
> 
> Giselle was the personification of talent, beauty and grace - a gifted artist, a talented musician, a paragon of style, an advocate for anyone in need, and the most generous spirit anyone could have had the good fortune to meet.
> 
> Giselle was an artist. Her art had no boundaries: painting, poetry, textile design, music, hair, and the list goes on. And no recounting of Giselle’s life would be complete without acknowledging a huge love of avocado toast, ramen, and the cakes she made that made it impossible to fit into jeans after the holidays.
> 
> Giselle was a Sophomore at Savannah College of Art and Design, and had a bright future in sustainable fashion and textiles. Sustainability and care for our world informed all aspects of the way she lived her life, from care of animals and veganism, to care for the community, to care for friends, family and loved ones. Giselle was proudly Jewish with strong ties to the Orangeburg Jewish Center, and lived life trying to embody Jewish values.
> 
> Struggle in life is present for all of us, and we marveled at Giselle’s fortitude and strength in dealing with personal struggles - both hers and the struggles of others - always always ALWAYS being kind, loving, and more compassionate to others than to her own well being.

Name: Guelila Elizabeth Iyob ("Gigi")
Description:
Gigi was non-binary. They died from long COVID complications. > On January 21st the world lost an incredible person. Our Gigi was only 25 years old when they unfortunately passed due to complications with long covid. Guelila's warm, kind, and gentle spirit was felt by thousands near and far. Behind Guelila's modest and gentle demeanor held a world full of immense and unimaginable talent, intelligence, and wit. Guelila reached thousands through one of their many gifts: makeup. > > Guelila was able to create new possibilities and push the bounds of creativity through their makeup. With the platform they built, Gigi used their talents to speak out against injustice, social issues, and challenge the world to be better. Gigi was a real advocate, comrade, and organizer in Black and Queer liberation. In their short time on this Earth, Gigi made an impact that will warm the hearts of the loved ones they leave behind forever. Gigi was supported by their mother, two siblings, extended family, friends, and their larger community up until taking their final rest. The funds from this GFM will go directly toward Gigi's family to aid in their transition to this new reality, relieve financial stress, and cover any remaining medical costs from Gigi's care. Gigi will be terribly missed, and we will uplift their name forever. 
Frozen. Confused. Shocked. Heartbreaking. There are minimal words for me to speak.
I was sitting on my bed, preparing dinner when the news came to reach.
I said to myself, "This can't be happening. Why is this the way I'm learning of your departure?"

You just turned 25 last month, with so much to prepare for a future.
The last time we talked, I was getting ready to watch Dreamgirls again.
It was another one of our joyous convos that we had some time to spend.
The first time we met was our first time coming to Towson Freedom School.

We clicked right away, and, ever since, I knew you were real and cool.
You have this uplifting energy and were always a source of light.
Every meeting, you always spoke truth to power and fought for what's right.
We followed each other on Twitter, and you always managed to crack me up.
There were times when we were flirting, and there were times I was like, "Girl, what?" ??

Name: Kelly Sousa
Description:
Kelly died in hospital just under two weeks after her boyfriend set fire to the car she was in.

> Kelly Sousa, the young woman whose body was burned after her boyfriend set fire to the car she was in, in the Promorar neighborhood, south of Teresina, succumbed to her injuries and died this Monday (22). The information was confirmed by the Teresina Emergency Hospital (HUT), where Kelly was admitted.
> 
> The crime of which Kelly was a victim took place on January 9th. According to police, there was a fight between the victim and her boyfriend, identified only as Cleiton. At the time, he set the car on fire with her inside her. Kelly's mother, an 80-year-old woman who have tried to intervene in the fight, was also injured and suffered minor burns to her leg.
> 
> The situation was witnessed by Kelly's sister, [name redacted]. According to her, the car exploded in flames. “I believe it must have been a bout of jealousy on my brother-in-law's part. The car was quickly consumed by flames and was a total loss”, explained Maria.
> 
> In addition to Kelly, Cleiton was also injured. They were rescued by neighbors, who heard the screams and saw smoke rising from the burning car.
> 
> The Teresina Emergency Hospital did not provide details regarding Kelly's exact cause of death. She was admitted to the health unit with serious injuries and burns all over her body.
> 
> The murder of Kelly Sousa is the second of a person from the LGBTQIAP+ community recorded in Teresina in just over a month. On December 10, [trans woman] Paloma da Silva, 34, died at HUT after being found with marks of a beating on her head. Three months earlier, another [trans woman], named Samara Amaral, was shot dead in the Parque Alvorada neighborhood .

>

> My best friend James Moen is a missing person from Grand Junction Colorado. He sent letters to his friends before disappearing to the Mesa in that area. If you see him or go around there and find his car: a black Nissan Maxima 2003 with no bumper and a busted front seat window on the drivers side, please contact the Grand Junction Police Department. He was my best friend online for 11 years and I’ve been in contact with people who were in person friends with him.

Name: Kal
Description:
Kal was killed by a criminal gang after leaving the house to buy food.

> The Civil Police of Ceará ( PC-CE ) presented a Final Report to the State Court on the death of the trans man identified as Kal, in Fortaleza, with the indictment of a suspect. According to investigations, the victim was dismembered by a criminal gang and had his body taken by a recycling cart to the place where the body was hidden, last Monday (29).
> 
> Elias Soares da Silva, 29 years old, arrested last Wednesday (31) , was indicted by the 2nd Police Station of the Department of Homicide and Personal Protection ( DHPP ) for qualified homicide (through torture), concealment of a corpse and for being part of of a criminal organization.
> 
> According to the Report, the trans man lived in the Varjota neighborhood and went to Granja Portugal, last Sunday night (28), to visit his partner. In the early hours of Monday (29), Kal had left the house with the intention of buying food, when he was approached by criminals from the region.
> 
> A friend of Kal's told the Civil Police that he was baptized by a faction from Ceará, that he did not know the area in Granja Portugal well and may have entered an area belonging to a rival faction, of Rio origin. And, "because he had exposed tattoos and was using electronic monitoring, he was an easy target," she said in testimony.
> 
> The Police Inquiry reveals that, upon being kidnapped by criminals, 'Kal' also called a friend at around 1:30 am that morning. The woman heard a man tell the victim to disconnect the call and an accomplice steal his cell phone from him. It was the young man's last cry for help.
> 
> The criminals accessed 'Kal's cell phone and saw the young man make a "three-finger" sign in videos and conversations on a social network. In the world of organized crime in Ceará the symbol represents a local faction to which the group was a rival.
> 
> The victim was taken to some location, where, in view of the images and videos published on social networks, he was tortured and killed, and his head, arms and fingers removed. After carrying out these acts, he was wrapped in a mattress and his body was thrown."
> 
> In addition to being dismembered, 'Kal's' body had 122 punctures from a piercing-cutting instrument. The body was found on Rua Teodoro de Castro, in the Granja Lisboa neighborhood, on Monday morning (29).
> 
> Civil Police investigations identified Elias Soares da Silva "as being the person who transported the victim's corpse to the dumping site, and may also have been one of the people involved in carrying out acts carrying out the homicide". The suspect was identified by witnesses, based on Photographic Recognition.
> 
> When questioned at the DHPP, Elias denied involvement in the crime and criminal faction. He also said that "he is homeless and works with recycling on the streets of the Conjunto Ceará and Granja Lisboa neighborhoods, using a cart to collect things on the streets and sell them, this being the way of his survival."
> 
> The arrest in the act of Elias da Silva was converted into preventive detention, by the State Court, after a custody hearing, last Thursday (1st). "The specific gravity of the conduct attributed to the accused is high, given the way in which the crimes were perpetrated, as there is evidence that the accused hid the corpse of a young woman who was brutally murdered and dismembered, in addition to the fact that the person being driven is being identified as a participant in this serious homicide, committed in the context of the criminal organization", considered judge Flávia Setúbal de Sousa Duarte.

Name: Amanda Soares ("Mandy Gin Drag")
TDoR list ref: tgeu/tdor2024/31-Jan-2024/Amanda de Souza Soares (""Mandy Gin Drag"")
Description:
Amanda's body was found with stab wounds after she had left her home - reportedly after receiving a phone call.

> Rio - The Civil Police investigates the stabbing murder of Amanda Soares, better known as Mandy Gin Drag, a trans woman, in the Jardim Nova República neighborhood, in São Gonçalo, Metropolitan Region, on Thursday (1st). The main line of investigation is that she may have been a victim of transphobia.
> 
> According to initial information passed on to the Niterói and São Gonçalo Homicide Police Station (DHNSG), Amanda received a call on Wednesday (31) and left in a hurry, leaving the house where she lived in São Gonçalo open and with the lights on. She didn't return.
> 
> On Thursday (1st), police officers from the 7th BPM (São Gonçalo) were called to a homicide in Jardim Nova República. At the scene, the military found the body and isolated the area for forensic examination. The body was then removed by firefighters and taken to the Legal Medical Institute (IML).
> 
> This Friday (2), representatives of the LGBTI+ Reference Center of São Gonçalo, a public facility of the Social Assistance of São Gonçalo City Hall, met with delegate Willians Batista, head of DHNSG, to monitor the investigations. The Center made itself available to the Civil Police in the case.
> 
> "It is suspected that she was a victim of transphobia. We will closely monitor the investigations. Our role
>  goes beyond providing guidance and offering services. We also look after the LGBTI+ community of São Gonçalo, so that crimes like this do not go unpunished" , he said in a statement .
> 
> Amanda Soares' burial will be this Saturday (3), at the Parque da Paz cemetery, in the Pacheco neighborhood.

Name: Parsa
Description:
Parsa was murdered by their father for "not conforming to traditional gender norms". Their killing followed 3 years of abuse for just being who they were.

Note that they/them pronouns are used here as we do not know how Parsa identified.

> ARTICLE 19 is shocked and saddened by the tragic murder of a 17-year old child in Iran for not conforming to traditional gender norms. We condemn the Islamic Republic’s propagation of hate towards members of the LGBTQ+ community, as well as the enabling framework of impunity for perpetrators of such reprehensible acts of crime, all of which result in gender apartheid in Iran. 
> 
> On 30 January 2024, local news outlet Rokna reported that the 17-year-old Iranian, which it identified as ‘Parsa’, had been murdered by their father over not conforming to rigid gender norms. For the purpose of this statement, since no reliable information is available about Parsa’s gender identity or sexual orientation, the they/them pronouns will be used.
> 
> In Iran, same-sex sexual acts are punishable by death and people not conforming to cisgender and heteronormative rules are persecuted by both state and non-state actors. Due to the lack of transparency in the Islamic Republic’s judicial system, there are no reliable statistics on the number of people charged for alleged ‘crimes’ related to their sexual orientation or gender identity. However, rights groups have extensively documented instances of queerphobic violence, including the gruesome murder of Alireza Fazeli Monfared by their family in 2021 and transmisogyny leading to the murder of trans youth Henar in 2022 and Siavash in 2018. 
>
> According to an interview Parsa’s father gave to Rokna while in custody after he committed murder, the child had endured abuse from their family as punishment for their gender non-conformist behaviour since the age of 14. The father referred to a list of behaviours that included using makeup, changing hair colour, and shaving body hair.
> 
> The father confessed that he had imprisoned Parsa at least once and had also forced them to go through ‘psychotherapy to be cured’. In face of the abuse, the child had previously escaped from home multiple times.
> 
> The child’s father eventually reached the point of murder after his alleged ‘shame’ before his community and after being informed of his child’s ‘heinous immoral acts’ with friends. Under the guise of taking his child to a psychiatric ward, he took Parsa to a place outside the city and murdered them. The 17-year-old child’s murder has once again laid bare the extent of harm caused by extreme and violent anti-LGBTQ discrimination. 
> 
> The case is a harrowing example of the Islamic Republic’s gender apartheid system, which permeates through every facet of Iranian society and its institutions. Parsa’s case follows similar crimes of child homicide.
